abstract: Meeting between Puerto Rican officials and commonwealth's creditors over its $72 billion debt suggests that effort to restructure debt will be protracted process; meeting is reminder of risks of investing in government debt, as any solution must not only deal with fiscal reality, but also with political liability.
lead_paragraph: Roughly 350 creditors were told they would have to wait several weeks until a working group of Puerto Rico leaders formed recommendations for resolving the island’s fiscal crisis.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Faces Its Creditors in Early Debt Resolution Talks
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Faces Its Creditors in Early Debt Resolution Talks

snippet: Roughly 350 creditors were told they would have to wait several weeks until a working group of Puerto Rico leaders formed recommendations for resolving the island’s fiscal crisis.
